info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 4:53PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Berkshire and southeastern Rensselaer Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 453 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hancock, or 9 miles northwest of Pittsfield, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Berlin around 505 PM EDT. Cheshire and New Ashford around 510 PM EDT. Adams and Williamstown around 525 PM EDT. North Adams around 530 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Hairpin Turn, Garfield, Greylock, North Stephentown, Sweets Corner, Soldiers Memorial Field, West Stephentown, North Hancock, Cheshire Harbor and Arnoldville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
